senses.sense_definition: The fibrous barb or shaft of a feather, particularly from a peacock or ostrich, used to create artificial flies for fishing.

examples.text: The angler carefully wrapped the peacock <w>herl</w> around the hook to form the body of the fly.
He prefers using ostrich <w>herl</w> because it adds excellent movement to the lure in the water.

senses.sense_definition: An artificial fly used in angling that is constructed using feather barbs.

examples.text: She selected a small <w>herl</w> from her box to mimic the insects on the water's surface.
The trout rose quickly to snatch the floating <w>herl</w> drifting downstream.

senses.sense_definition: A single strand or filament of hair.

examples.text: A single <w>herl</w> of hair fell across her forehead, distracting her from her work.
The microscope revealed the rough texture of the damaged hair <w>herl</w>.
Mr. <w>Herl</w> arrived late for the board meeting due to heavy traffic.
We visited the <w>Herl</w> family in their new home last weekend.
